Trial_Design.evidence: 30 patients undergoing elective head and neck cancer surgery were randomized into two groups

Participants.evidence: 30 patients undergoing elective head and neck cancer surgery

Intervention.evidence: Group E (cervical epidural analgesia with general anesthesia), and group G (general anesthesia alone)

Objective.evidence: The aim of this study was to evaluate cervical epidural analgesia in terms of opioid and anesthetic requirements and stress response

Method_Outcome.evidence: Opioid and anesthetic drug requirement was observed. Blood glucose and serum cortisol levels were measured

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: 30 patients undergoing elective head and neck cancer surgery were randomized into two groups

Number_Randomised.evidence: 30 patients undergoing elective head and neck cancer surgery were randomized into two groups

Result_Outcome.evidence: There was significant reduction in the requirement of morphine ( P < 0.001), isoflurane ( P = 0.004) and vecuronium ( P = 0.001) in group E
